title: [netlib-xblas] [Failed to use the built-in test case] The self-test of the netlib-xblas fails.
body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->
Hi,I meet a problem about the self-test of the netlib-xblas fails.
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
[root@localhost ~]# spack install --keep-stage -v netlib-xblas
[root@localhost ~]# spack cd netlib-xblas
[root@localhost spack-src]# ls
LICENSE   Makefile.m4  README.devel    config      config.status  configure.ac  libxblas.a  make.conf  make.gnu  make.ia64  make.inc     make.intel  removed_la_files.txt  testall.result   testing
Makefile  README       autom4te.cache  config.log  configure      doc           m4          make.cray  make.hp   make.ibm   make.inc.in  make.sun    src                   testall.summary
[root@localhost spack-src]# . ../spack-build-env.txt
[root@localhost spack-src]# make tests
cd m4/test-dot && make
make[1]: Entering directory '/tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-netlib-xblas-1.0.248-63ev76doyqlenul2ibbcq2i6mhsurcq6/spack-src/m4/test-dot'
```

I have found that the Makefile in the m4 module does not work. The Makefile in the src file may not work for the Makefile in the m4 module. The specific reason is that the software is outdated (in 2018 (github)). In addition, no community (the source code community netlib-xblas does not have iSuse) is being maintained. The same problem occurs in the x86 system test of CentOS, and the reason is the same. Can we discard this software version? The xblas community hasn't been maintained since 2018.
